result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Switalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called: 10:07am.  Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears by Atty Richard Lawson. State provides Amended Information to the Court. Atty Lawson does not object to filing Amended Information. W/R. Plea: Not Guilty. Bond to Continue. Atty Lawson moves to for 10 days to file Motions - crt grants. DATES: Status 9/4/14 @ 10:15am. Adjourned: 10:08am.

No contact with victim(s): Children under 18.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney, In public places (i.e grocery stores, etc) there may be incidental contact with minors and in the work setting the employer should be aware of the minor supervision clause in the bond.  **Defendant may have supervised (by an adult over the age of 25) contact with minor relatives.  Defendant may not leave the State but may leave the County. Not to go on the internet.

Clerk Deanna.
